item.title: All Geometry Dash Codes (October 2025)
item.description:
Jump Links

  • All Codes For Geometry Dash
  • All Active The Wraith Vault Codes
  • All Active Vault Codes
  • All Active Vault of Secrets Codes
  • All Active Chamber of Time Codes

Geometry Dash launched in August 2013 and quickly earned a cult following that appreciated the rhythm-based game. Jamming to the music of every level, players did their best to complete various Geometry Dash levels and earn diamonds and other prizes to unlock more in-game content, such as avatars and modes. Developed by RobTop Games, Geometry Dash rose quickly in its player base, and has remained prominent among indie gamers, thanks to its simple approach and rise in players across social media platforms. Players can also develop their own levels, challenging fellow Geometry Dash players around the world to take it on for bragging rights.

Updated October 19, 2025, by Artur Novichenko: There are plenty of working codes available in Geometry Dash , offering everything from Mana Orbs and Diamonds to unique icons, ships, and colors. You can also unlock Demon Keys, shards, and exclusive designs across the game’s vaults. These codes bring a mix of cosmetic and collectible rewards to enhance your experience. Keep an eye on this guide, as more codes may appear with future updates.

All Codes For Geometry Dash

Geometry Dash players looking to add some extra icons and colors can gain access to a set of three vaults; The Vault, The Vault of Secrets, and The Chamber of Time, all of which come with their own series of codes and unlockables for this mobile game. Each vault requires certain criteria in order to be unlocked, and until then, players will not be able to access them or use any of the available codes.

These codes will also expire at random intervals, so redeeming them quickly is essential to ensuring access to the available icons and colors. Codes can only be redeemed once per account. Be sure to check back frequently, as codes can be released anytime during the month to introduce new stages, icons, and colors.

Codes Checked on October 18, 2025.

All Active The Wraith Vault Codes

  • thickofit – 1 Mana Orb​ (NEW)
  • skibidi – 1 Mana Orb (NEW)
  • fireinthehole – 1 Fire Shard​ (NEW)
  • robtopisnice – 10 Mana Orbs​ (NEW)
  • bussin – 69 Mana Orbs​ (NEW)
  • wellmet – 5 Diamonds​ (NEW)
  • checksteam – 1 Demon Key​ (NEW)
  • touchgrass – 1 Earth Shard (NEW)
  • wateronthehill – 1 Ice Shard​ (NEW)
  • backondash – Cube 409​ (NEW)
  • key – 1 Demon Key​ (NEW)
  • geometry – Ball 90​ (NEW)
  • citadel – Cube 231​ (NEW)
  • retrospective – Ship 121​ (NEW)
  • iaminpain – 10 Diamonds, 100 Mana Orbs​ (NEW)
  • ruins – Ball 91​ (NEW)
  • spacegauntlet – 20 Diamonds, 1 Demon Key, 2 Metal Shards​ (NEW)
  • cheatcodes – UFO 138 (NEW)
  • backstreetboy – Robot 37​ (NEW)
  • noelelectra – Swing 17​ (NEW)
  • gd2025 – 1 Yellow Key, 25 Diamonds, 25 Mana Orbs​ (NEW)
  • duckstep – Ship 146​ (NEW)
  • skylinept2 – Cube 309​ (NEW)
  • boogie – Wave 92​ (NEW)
  • buttonmasher – UFO 63​ (NEW)
  • gdawards – Cube 485 (NEW)
  • ncsalbum – Jetpack 8​ (NEW)
  • gullible – 1 Mana Orb​ (NEW)
  • putyahandsup – UFO 71​ (NEW)

How to Redeem The Wraith Vault Codes in Geometry Dash

To redeem codes in The Wraith vault, you need to do the following:

  1. Open Geometry Dash and navigate to the main levels screen.​
  2. Scroll to find and select The Tower level.​
  3. Once inside The Tower, tap the icon resembling a face located in the bottom right corner to access The Wraith vault.​
  4. Enter each code into the text box one at a time.​
  5. If the code everything is okay, the corresponding reward will be granted.​

All Active Vault Codes

  • Lenny – Lenny icon
  • Blockbite – UFO
  • Spooky – Shy Guy Icon
  • Neverending – UFO
  • Mule – Ship
  • Ahead – Wave
  • Gandalfpotter – Trail
  • Sparky – Secret Coin
  • Robotop – Robot
  • (enter your in-game username) – Eye
  • 8-16-30-32-46-84 – Illuminati Wave

How to Redeem Vault Codes in Geometry Dash

Players can unlock The Vault in Geometry Dash by simply collecting 10 Silver User Coins . One method to get three Silver User Coins is to complete an Online Feature Level without dying. After unlocking the Vault in Geometry Dash , follow these easy steps to gain access to The Vault and use the aforementioned codes:

  1. Launch the game and open Settings by tapping on the icon at the bottom of the screen.
  2. An open lock icon will appear in the top right corner of the screen, which can be clicked to enter The Vault.
  3. In the box under the ‘ What are you poking around for?’ message, enter each available code, one at a time.
  4. If the code is correctly entered and is still valid, the reward will be distributed.

All Active Vault of Secrets Codes

  • Robotop – Robot
  • Octocube – the Octopus-Shaped Icon
  • Brain Power – the Brain-Shaped Icon
  • Seven – Finn (Adventure Time) Icon
  • thechickenisonfire – Swamp Green color
  • The Challenge – Vault Keepers level
  • Gimmiethecolor – Dark Red color
  • (Your number of stars*) – an Icon (players can find the number of stars on the game's main menu)
  • It’s a Puzzle – an Icon
  • Glubfub – a Secret Coin

How to Redeem Vault of Secrets Codes in Geometry Dash

In order to use the codes listed above, players will need to earn 50 Diamonds in Geometry Dash . This can be done by opening daily chests, completing daily quests, opening Treasure Room chests, opening a weekly Demon chest, and attempting Gauntlet levels. Once players have acquired the appropriate amount of gems, the following steps will need to be taken:

  1. Launch the game and click on the icon in the main menu.
  2. Click on the unlocked icon in the top right corner of the screen, this time choosing to enter The Vault of Secrets.
  3. Enter the desired code in the text box.
  4. If the code is correctly entered and is still valid, the reward will be distributed.

All Active Chamber of Time Codes

  • Volcano – Wave
  • River – Dark Green color
  • Silence – Second default Icon
  • Darkness – Face Icon
  • Hunger – Hungry Icon

How to Redeem Chamber of Time in Geometry Dash

To use the codes listed above, players will need to go to The Vault of Secrets, begin the secret challenge, and beat it to unlock The Chamber of Time in Geometry Dash . Players have to go through the following steps in order to gain access to the codes:

  1. Go to The Vault of Secrets and type " The Challenge" in the code redemption box, without quotations. This will begin a level that costs 200 Diamonds to enter.
  2. Complete the level and then tap on the door icon in the bottom right area of the screen .
  3. Go to the basement to find a locked demon who will ask you to unlock the door. Tap on all three keyholes to activate them.
  4. Go to the "Coming Soon!" section on the game's main selection page and click on the "i" icon to prompt a door and interact with the gatekeeper.
  5. Go back to The Vault of Secrets with 500 Diamonds in hand and press the button to enter an area with a green rope. Click it to open the secret shop and purchase the Master Emblem. Go back to the "Coming Soon!" section and open the door to enter the third chamber. Once inside, enter the code to redeem the prize.
Geometry Dash
7.3 /10
Released
August, 2013

WHERE TO PLAY

DIGITAL

Jump and fly your way through danger in this rhythm-based action platformer!

Prepare for a near impossible challenge in the world of Geometry Dash. Push your skills to the limit as you jump, fly and flip your way through dangerous passages and spiky obstacles.

Simple one touch game play with lots of levels that will keep you entertained for hours!

Rhythm-based Action Platforming! Lots of levels with unique soundtracks! Build and share your own levels using the level editor! Unlock new icons and colors to customize your character!

Fly rockets, flip gravity and much more! Use practice mode to sharpen your skills! Lots of achievements and rewards! Challenge yourself with the near impossible!

Developer(s)
Robert Topala
Platform(s)
Android, iOS, PC
Powered by

item.title: How to Get & Evolve Inkay in Pokemon Legends Z-A
item.description:
Inkay is one of the most sought-after species in Pokemon Legends: Z-A, thanks to the addition of Mega Malamar as one of the new Mega Evolutions added with the game. It is also one of the most tricky Pokemon to evolve, as it requires some tinkering with the Nintendo Switch, and in Legends Z-A , with the new evolution system, this becomes really hard to accomplish if players don't know the trick.

Here, players will learn how to find and catch Inkay, and if the trick to evolve Inkay is not working , then this guide might shed some light on why this is happening, and how to fix this issue to evolve Inkay into Malamar. Players will also find information on how to turn their Malamar into Mega Malamar, the Dark/Psychic-type Pokemon that is breaking the game with its powerful combination of attacks.

How to Get Inkay in Pokemon Legends Z-A

To get Inkay in Pokemon Legends Z-A , players need to travel to Wild Zone 1 1, located in the lower right part of Lumiose City. Wild Zone 11 becomes unlocked once players have defeated the first three Rogue Mega evolved Pokemon (Camerupt, Victreebel, Slowbro). Once players unlock this area, they will find Inkay roaming around the water ponds only at night, so take a break from the A-Z Royale and go catch some squids.

When going to Wild Area 11 to catch Inkay, be careful with the Alpha Clawitzer prowling around, as it becomes increasingly hard to deal with all the swarming Clauncher it summons once the battle starts.

Once players have secured an Inkay (which will be around level 30), they can go ahead and try to evolve it. Some players might remember that the trick to evolve it is by turning around their console, but, there's a catch. This doesn't seem to work anymore , and not even the evolution arrow appears in their thumbnail. Next, we will dive into why this happens and how to fix it.

How to Evolve Inkay into Malamar

If players want to evolve Inkay into Malamar, they will need to have it at level 30 (minimum) and before they flip around their console, they should follow these steps:

  1. Open the menu (X) , then hover over Inkay.
  2. Select Inkay to open its Pokemon tab .
  3. Now, flip the Console upside down and the Evolve option will appear .
  4. Press Evolve to turn Inkay into Malamar.

It is extremely important that players open Inkay's menu before fliping the console, otherwise, the trick will not work. By doing this, players will get Malamar in their team, and now they will be ready to Mega Evolve it into Mega Malamar.

How To Unlock Mega Malamar in Pokemon Legends Z-A

Inkay

Malamar

Mega Malamar

To Evolve Malamar into Mega Malamar, in Pokemon Legends Z-A, players need Malamarite , which can be bought at Quasartico Headquarters located in the Magenta District of Lumiose . Players need to invest 240 Mega Shards to purchase the Malamarite, and this Mega Stone becomes available later during the adventure, so prepare to beat a few tough Rogue Mega Pokemon (like Beedrill, Banette, and Hawlucha) first.

Once players have Malamarite , they should make Malamar hold it , and then gather enough Mega Energy during combat and tap (L ). This will evolve it temporarily into Mega Malamar, increasing Malamar Base Stats by a total of 100 (from 482 to 582) which is defintely a step up. Sadly, its increase is focused on SpDef, which in a game where players can move around their Pokemon at will to dodge attacks, doesn't convince trainers too much. Still, its other boosted stats (Atk, SpA, Spe) are a thing to consider, since Malamar has access to moves like Psyshock and Night Slash.

But perhaps, its most powerful move is Topsy-Turvy , a special debuff move that used to be unique to Malamar, which does something incredible: Turns all stat buffs into debuffs (and vice versa). This means that if the opponent maxed out SpA and Atk using Work Up, Malamar can turn it into 6 Stage Dual Debuff, which is absolutely nuts. With this move, Malamar/Mega Malamar becomes quite a fearsome foe to counter buffers.

Your comment has not been saved

Follow
Followed

item.title: Disney Dreamlight Valley: All Characters Schedule
item.description:
Unlike Critters in Disney Dreamlight Valley , characters won’t stay in the same Biome. Instead, the villagers will wander around the valley or rest inside their houses. Additionally, Dreamers may encounter certain characters while visiting Chez Remy or Scrooge McDuck’s store.

Each character has a schedule that they follow in Disney Dreamlight Valley . If players require speaking with a certain villager to progress in a Friendship Quest or to simply trigger a new one, it’s important to figure out each character's schedule in DDV .

Updated on June 30, 2025, by Nahda Nabiilah: Thanks to the Wonderland Whimsy and the Mysteries of Skull Rock updates, players can now interact with four more characters in Disney Dreamlight Valley. One of them is the infamous Forgotten, who used to be a wandering character that could not be befriended. Dreamers can now level up The Forgotten friendship level by giving them gifts and hanging out. Therefore, you will benefit greatly from knowing any characters' schedule to unlock more friendship quests in DDV.

Characters Schedule In DDV - Disney Dreamlight Valley

As players will notice, some characters in Disney Dreamlight Valley only sleep, like in Ariel and Ursula’s case, while others, like Scrooge McDuc,k don’t leave the store at all. Here’s a complete list of the available characters in DDV and their schedule:

December 5, 2023
ESRB
Everyone / In-Game Purchases, Users Interact
Developer(s)
Gameloft
Publisher(s)
Gameloft
10 Images

WHERE TO PLAY

SUBSCRIPTION
DIGITAL

Disney Dreamlight Valley is a hybrid between a life-sim and an adventure game rich with quests, exploration, and engaging activities featuring Disney and Pixar friends, both old and new.

Once an idyllic land, Dreamlight Valley was a place where Disney and Pixar characters lived in harmony—until the Forgetting. Night Thorns grew across the land and severed the wonderful memories tied to this magical place. With nowhere else to go, the hopeless inhabitants of Dreamlight Valley retreated behind locked doors in the Dream Castle.Now it’s up to you to discover the stories of this world and bring the magic back to Dreamlight Valley.

Free the Dream Castle from the insidious grip of the Forgetting, and unlock the unique Realms of well-loved Disney and Pixar characters, including great queens and kings such as Anna and Simba. Each Realm contains unique challenges with puzzles to solve in the quest to bring friendship back to the Valley.

You’ll start your adventure in the Valley, but your journey will take you to infinity… and beyond! Explore what lurks in the Forest of Valor and brave the deepest caverns as you take on challenges from iconic Disney and Pixar heroes and villains. Who knows who—or what—you might discover.

Engine
unity

item.title: All Spewpa Locations in Pokemon Legends Z-A (Spewpa in the Museum Guide)
item.description:
In Pokemon Legends: Z-A players will have to solve tons of mysteries and help the inhabitants of the colorful Lumiose City by completing a series of Missions, and among the many Secondary Missions , there's one called Spewpa in the Museum.

Players will need to help a couple of fans of Spewpa find all their 12 Pokemon who have decided to go missing among the Art Exhibitions and some (blast from the past) Hisuian goodies donated to the Museum. So, here in this guide, players will find the locations for all twelve Spewpa missing in Lumiose City's Museum.

How To Complete Spewpa in the Museum in Pokemon Legends Z-A

Once players talk to the trainer couple located at the first floor of Lumiose City's Museum, they will have to start looking for 12 Spewpa scattered across the exhibitions.

The first Spewpa is located not far from the couple, right behind them next to the stairs. Approach it and say hello, so that the Spewpa returns with them. Now backtrack a little, to the exhibition where the huge Lucario statue is placed (Remember the Battle Tower?). There's a second Spewpa tucked in between the Statue and the wall there.

Now back to where the first Spewpa was, there's a third one on the stairs that lead to the 2nd floor, between two couches . Once players have reached the upper level's exhibition, look around for a display of 'All types of Poke Ball,' among them, there's a suspicious little fellow: the fourth Spewpa, posing as a Poke Ball.

The fifth Spewpa is located over the Hologram of Lumiose City , it's hard to miss, and the sixth Spewpa is sitting on a couch , directly looking at the Hologram.

The seventh and eight Spewpa are on the display cases of the Survey Corp's uniforms (From Pokemon Legends: Arceus ) and their equipment .

The ninth Spewpa is located on the small model of a Hisuian Store , and the tenth Spewpa is hidden among the ancient portraits on the wall.

The eleventh Spewpa is perched atop the Galaxy Team armor (as if it were a little helmet). The last one is looking at the Hisuian Hyeroglyphs , and with that, players already have the 12 Missing Spewpa, and will be returned to the couple on the first floor to receive their rewards.

Turns out there's a 13th Spewpa among their collection , and they cannot have it with them. So, the players will be gifted with a Blue Pattern Spewpa, that if its evolved into Vivillon it will exhibit its characteristic Blue Wings. It is a lovely Pokemon, but not worth the time training as it has poor stats and its moveset is quite lackluster. Still, with this Vivillon and the ones caught in Lumiose players should be 18 patterns away from completing their collection in Pokemon Legends Z-A .

Your comment has not been saved

item.title: Best EA Games
item.description:
There are many people around who are very eager to label EA as one of the most polarizing gaming companies of all time, but the truth is that this organization has had a hand in shaping some of the greatest games of all time. Nearly everyone has played a game published by Electronic Arts at some point or another, and they might be personal favorites.

There are many fantastic games with EA's label on them that have become some of the best video game experiences that fans can expose themselves to. The best EA games encompass a wide range of genres and will be quite appealing to gamers with varying and selective tastes.

To qualify, a game has to be published by EA. While we will be double-dipping into certain franchises, variety is the spice of life, so we will try to highlight as many IPs as possible.

Updated on October 19, 2025, by Mark Sammut: EA is back in the spotlight, for multiple reasons. However, the most pressing one for this context is Battlefield 6, which marks a huge return to form and prominence for the FPS series. While it is still too early to say if the game will have the legs to eventually be remembered as one of the best Electronic Arts games ever, it is certainly a candidate.

We have added a few more classics to this article.

23 Alice: Madness Returns

Gorgeous And Creative Locations, Along With Decent Combat

Alice: Madness Returns
6 /10
8.0 /10
Released
June 14, 2011

WHERE TO PLAY

DIGITAL
PHYSICAL

Developer(s)
Spicy Horse
Platform(s)
PC, PS3, Xbox 360
How Long To Beat
15 Hours
Powered by

A follow-up to American McGee's Alice , which is also great and creepy, Alice: Madness Returns marks one of the few EA games that goes down a hack and slash route akin to something like Devil May Cry , albeit considerably more simplified. For the most part, the publisher has avoided this genre, but Madness Returns proves that might be a mistake. Spicy Horse put together a wildly imaginative and dark adventure that takes Alice back to Wonderland, although it looks absolutely nothing like the version found in Disney's movie.

Although they have a habit of overstaying their welcome, each stage looks like a work of nightmarish art, filled with creatures that would not look out of place in a full-blown horror game. Despite being far from perfect, Alice: Madness Returns is exactly the type of game that has been missing from the gaming industry in recent years. Here is an ambitious AA game that combines stunning art with fun combat, decent platforming, and abstract storytelling.

22 Unravel

A Simple Puzzle Adventure With Charming Visuals

Unravel
9 /10
Released
February 9, 2016

WHERE TO PLAY

SUBSCRIPTION
DIGITAL
PHYSICAL

Developer(s)
Coldwood Interactive
Platform(s)
PS4, Xbox One, PC
OpenCritic Rating
Strong
Powered by

Unravel was one of the first projects that was supported by the EA Originals program, and it is indeed one of the best experiences in the collection. The game follows the adventure of a thread of yarn that unravels as it moves forward, and this unraveling becomes the core gameplay mechanic.

The players can use the yarn to solve a variety of platforming puzzles, like swinging, climbing, and even saving the game. Despite the fact that Unravel was developed by a small indie studio, it features stunning and charming visuals that make the adventure more enjoyable.

As a combat-free experience, Unravel also tells a story through the memory pieces that the player finds, though no dialogues are ever traded.

21 Star Wars Jedi: Fallen Order

Resurrecting Story-Driven Star Wars Games Under Respawn

Star Wars Jedi: Fallen Order
8.6 /10
Released
November 15, 2019

WHERE TO PLAY

SUBSCRIPTION
DIGITAL
PHYSICAL

Developer(s)
Respawn Entertainment
Franchise
Star Wars
Platform(s)
PS5, PS4, Xbox Series X, Xbox Series S, Xbox One, PC, Stadia
OpenCritic Rating
Strong
Powered by

Fallen Order 's launch was rough, with a wealth of bugs marring what should've been a fun experience. Thankfully, Respawn wasted no time in ironing out the kinks, letting players enjoy an incredible video game that is arguably one of the finest single-player Star Wars games around.

Cal Kestis is a compelling protagonist who ends up playing a major role without being too grating in the process. Jedi: Survivor continues the story of this hero, and it's a shame that the launch of this title somehow managed to be even more broken than its predecessor.

20 FIFA 15

One Of The Most Balanced Games In The Series Ever

FIFA 15
8 /10
OpenCritic Reviews
Top Critic Avg: 83 /100 Critics Rec: 80%

WHERE TO PLAY

DIGITAL
PHYSICAL

OpenCritic Rating
Strong
Powered by

Most people would just dismiss the FIFA series and comment on the fact that every title is pretty much interchangeable when it comes to the gameplay. While this is true to an extent, there's no denying that the polished gameplay of this annual sports video game series makes the act of controlling one's favorite soccer team to score goals a highly engaging one.

FIFA 12 and 15 are considered by many to be two of the best games in the long-running series, with the latter edging out the former because of how fun its gameplay felt. Later titles have tried to make some changes to the gameplay with varying degrees of success, but FIFA 15 continues to stand strong as one of the greatest sports games that deserves all the time in the spotlight, and then some.

19 The Saboteur

A Stealth-Based Open-World Experience Set In World War 2

The Saboteur
8.8 /10
Released
December 8, 2009

WHERE TO PLAY

DIGITAL

Developer(s)
Pandemic Studios
Platform(s)
PC, PS3, Xbox 360
Powered by

The Saboteur was one of those doomed games that not only received a sequel but also had its developer shut down, all despite being a well-crafted experience. The game's approach to an open-world adventure still remains quite unique, as the game was set in Nazi-invaded France back in World War 2.

The story was well-written with some memorable characters, and the gameplay was really enjoyable. The Saboteur feels like a combination of Hitman and Assassin's Creed , where the player can use stealth mechanics to infiltrate the Nazi bases and blow them up while being able to climb up buildings and use rooftops as a faster and sneakier way of traversal.

The Saboteur did a good job in almost every aspect, though it wasn't flawless in any of them. It's a shame that the IP was canned back then, as it could have evolved even more with potential sequels.

18 Crysis

A Challenging First-Person Shooter With GPU-Melting Visuals

Crysis Remastered
5 /10
Released
July 23, 2020

WHERE TO PLAY

SUBSCRIPTION
DIGITAL
PHYSICAL

Developer(s)
Saber Interactive
Franchise
Crysis
Platform(s)
PC, PS4, Switch, Xbox One
OpenCritic Rating
Weak
Powered by

Crysis blew everyone's minds when it launched, with the graphics of this title being so advanced that even high-end rigs at the time had a problem running this game. The revolutionary CryEngine was a huge reason why this game was so ahead of its time, ensuring that players would remember this title as one of the best EA games ever made.

Controlling Nomad and using his nanosuit to take out hostile soldiers makes for a great time, with players accessing their power fantasies as they become invisible and use the enhanced power of their nanosuit to grab hapless soldiers and fling them around like ragdolls. Players who managed to run Crysis at the time were more than impressed by its immense graphics that look even better in the Remastered edition of this title.

17 Dragon Age: Inquisition

Elevating The Dragon Age Experience To A New Height In Storytelling And Gameplay

Dragon Age: Inquisition
9 /10
13
8.2 /10
Released
November 18, 2014

WHERE TO PLAY

SUBSCRIPTION
DIGITAL
PHYSICAL

Developer(s)
BioWare
Franchise
Dragon Age
Platform(s)
PS4, PS3, Xbox One, Xbox 360, PC
OpenCritic Rating
Mighty
Powered by

Despite the many problems that plagued Dragon Age: Inquisition during its development, most people agreed that it was a solid addition to the franchise and a step in the right direction after Dragon Age 2 attempted to make the franchise appeal to a broader market. Forming an Inquisition and saving the world from Corypheus' malevolence is a blast, especially with the many things players can do along the way.

The idea of separating the story into DLCs was maligned by many, but Inquisition has slowly garnered a positive reputation over time. It's easy to see why players are hotly anticipating the release of Dragon Age: The Veilguard , even if the reveal of this game worried many. Fans will be replaying this game right now to keep their memory fresh when it comes to the series' impressive lore.

16 Dragon Age: Origins

A Solid Foundation For A Long-Living Franchise

Dragon Age: Origins
9 /10
17
9.1 /10
Released
November 3, 2009

WHERE TO PLAY

DIGITAL
PHYSICAL

Developer(s)
BioWare
Franchise
Dragon Age
Platform(s)
PS3, Xbox 360, PC
Powered by

The acquisition of BioWare by EA allowed the studio to flex a big budget in their game like never before. After being hailed as the king of the CRPG genre, the company moved to a more mainstream action-focused title with the advent of Dragon Age: Origins .

The experiment was a massive success, with the varying origins of the player character, a rich fantasy world, and some great storytelling turning Dragon Age: Origins into one of the most beloved Western RPGs of all time. To this day, fans still consider this game to be the best title in the series, and understandably so.

15 The Sims 3

Expanding The Series Into An Open-World Experience

The Sims 3
8.5 /10
Released
June 2, 2009

WHERE TO PLAY

DIGITAL
PHYSICAL

Developer(s)
Maxis
Franchise
The Sims
Platform(s)
PS3, Xbox 360, Wii, 3DS, Nintendo DS, PC, Android, iOS
Powered by

Most people consider The Sims 3 to be the best game in this popular life simulation series, with the inclusion of a seamless open world and new mechanics being seen as groundbreaking by many. While this game could be rather demanding for PCs at the time, it didn't take long before post-launch support for this game stabilized the experience.

This, coupled with the wealth of new content that was added, made The Sims 3 one of the best video games ever made. The reason why so many people continue to be disappointed by The Sims 4 is because it was a step down from its predecessor in many ways, and fans can only hope that The Sims 5 doesn't repeat the same mistakes.

14 Battlefield 4

A Significant Evolution In Multiplayer Experience Of The Series

Battlefield 4
7 /10
9.6 /10
Released
October 29, 2013

WHERE TO PLAY

SUBSCRIPTION
DIGITAL

Developer(s)
DICE
Franchise
Battlefield
Platform(s)
Xbox 360, Xbox One, PS3, PS4, PC
OpenCritic Rating
Strong
Powered by

Battlefield 4 might not feature the high-octane story campaign of its predecessor, but it indeed took the multiplayer experience in the franchise to the next level with amazing maps, jaw-dropping destruction physics, and a variety of fairly balanced weapons and vehicles.

It's no joke that Battlefield 4 still had many active players after Battlefield 2042 's release until Electronic Arts decided to shut the servers down back in 2024. The game is still the best modern warfare experience that the series has managed to deliver so far, thanks to its fluent gunplay and well-designed classes.
